sentence: Shares of Universal Forest Products Inc.UFPI touched a new 52-week high of $77.89 during its trading session on Nov 23.
This apex improved upon the last 52-week high of $77.44 hit on Nov 6.
Universal Forest Products closed the session at $77.59, reflecting a solid year-to-date return of 46.9%.
The trading volume for the session was 0.14 million shares.
After the company reported better-than-expected results for the third quarter, earnings estimates for 2015 were revised upward, reflecting further potential for this building products stock.
In the trailing four quarters, Universal Forest Products reported better-than-expected results, with an average positive earnings surprise of 8.34%.
Lately, the company's third-quarter earnings beat as well as the announcement of a 5% increase in semi-annual dividend rate pushed the share price up to a new high.
Universal Forest Products remains well positioned to leverage benefits from strengthening demand in the U.S. construction market, especially in commercial construction.
Housing starts are predicted to remain strong in the quarters ahead.
For 2015, Universal Forest Products expects an improvement in the top line, backed by addition of customers and products to its portfolio.
Also, enhancement of operating margin remains the primary area of focus.
In addition, Universal Forest Products' cash position remains solid, having recorded 72.1% year-over-year increase in cash from operating activities in the first nine months of 2015.
Also, the company's cash and cash equivalents surged 147% sequentially in the third quarter.
Such improvement is expected to support the company's commitment toward rewarding its shareholders handsomely through dividend payments and share buybacks.
Over the last 60 days, the Zacks Consensus Estimate for Universal Forest Products increased 6.9% to $3.87 per share for 2015; while the same grew 6.6% to $4.35 for 2016.
These estimates represent year-over-year growth of 33% for 2015 and 12.3% for 2016.
With a market capitalization of $1.6 billion, Universal Forest Products currently sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).
Other stocks worth considering in the building products industry include Comfort Systems USA Inc.
FIX , The Home Depot, Inc. HD and Energy Focus, Inc. EFOI .
All three stocks carry a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
